title: Von hier für dich
description: As part of my bachelor thesis, I developed a Flutter app enabling local retailers to sell their products online, bridging the gap between traditional and digital commerce. Von hier für dich explores the use of Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) and cloud technologies to fast-track app development.

title: PockNote
description: PockNote is a lightweight note-taking app I developed to meet my personal needs and preferences after a long search for the perfect solution. It features a minimalistic and distraction-free design, cross-device synchronization, and availability.</br>The app's frontend is built with Next.js, while the backend uses a Java Spring Boot Microservice architecture, both hosted in Docker containers. I also integrated Clerk for secure and efficient authentication. The hosted version is part of my daily workflow, and the source code will be published soon.

title: Requirement Classifier
description: As part of my paper Instabilität und Ungewissheit nicht-funktionaler Anforderungen, I developed an AI-powered classification system to analyze software requirements. The model differentiates between functional and non-functional requirements and assigns a probability score for key categories. The system consists of a neural network-based NLP model, which communicates with a Django web interface via FastAPI. The paper was graded with a score of 95%.

title: Cargonaut
description: Cargonaut is a platform for booking and offering rideshares and freight shipping services. I developed the frontend using Next.js and React, creating a user-friendly and responsive interface. The platform also includes a chat function to facilitate seamless communication between users.

title: PocketDo
description: PocketDo is a fully responsive to-do app that helps you organize your tasks and navigate your day. Built using React + Vite for a fast and seamless user experience and Pocketbase as a lightweight backend solution. To be published soon

title: Cards Trainer
description: Cards Trainer is an interactive online flashcard tool that makes learning fun with achievements to keep you motivated. I contributed to both the Angular frontend and the Java Spring Boot backend, leveraging a microservice architecture and a PostgreSQL database for a scalable and efficient platform.

title: Hello, friend!-Portfolio
description: Hello, friend!-Portfolio is a playful and interactive portfolio! This project is built using simple HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and it features a unique design that allows users to switch between light and dark modes with a single click. The centerpiece of the portfolio is an animated cat that changes its behavior depending on the mode—sleeping during the day and waking up at night.
